verses.esv: 33 “When a stranger sojourns with you in your land, you shall not do him wrong. 34 You shall treat the stranger who sojourns with you as the native among you, and you shall love him as yourself, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
verses.kjv: 33 And if a stranger sojourn with thee in your land, ye shall not vex him. 34 But the stranger that dwelleth with you shall be unto you as one born among you, and thou shalt love him as thyself; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
verses.niv: 33 "'When an alien lives with you in your land, do not mistreat him. 34 The alien living with you must be treated as one of your native-born. Love him as yourself, for you were aliens in Egypt. I am the LORD your God.

verses.esv: 9 “You shall not oppress a sojourner. You know the heart of a sojourner, for you were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
verses.kjv: 9 Also thou shalt not oppress a stranger: for ye know the heart of a stranger, seeing ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
verses.niv: 9 "Do not oppress an alien; you yourselves know how it feels to be aliens, because you were aliens in Egypt.

verses.esv: 21 “You shall not wrong a sojourner or oppress him, for you were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
verses.kjv: 21 Thou shalt neither vex a stranger, nor oppress him: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
verses.niv: 21 "Do not mistreat an alien or oppress him, for you were aliens in Egypt.

verses.esv: 19 Love the sojourner, therefore, for you were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
verses.kjv: 19 Love ye therefore the stranger: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
verses.niv: 19 And you are to love those who are aliens, for you yourselves were aliens in Egypt.

verses.esv: 2 Do not neglect to show hospitality to strangers, for thereby some have entertained angels unawares.
verses.kjv: 2 Be not forgetful to entertain strangers: for thereby some have entertained angels unawares.
verses.niv: 2 Do not forget to entertain strangers, for by so doing some people have entertained angels without knowing it.

verses.esv: 5 “Then I will draw near to you for judgment. I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers, against the adulterers, against those who swear falsely, against those who oppress the hired worker in his wages, the widow and the fatherless, against those who thrust aside the sojourner, and do not fear me, says the LORD of hosts.
verses.kjv: 5 And I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers, and against the adulterers, and against false swearers, and against those that oppress the hireling in his wages, the widow, and the fatherless, and that turn aside the stranger from his right, and fear not me, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.niv: 5 "So I will come near to you for judgment. I will be quick to testify against sorcerers, adulterers and perjurers, against those who defraud laborers of their wages, who oppress the widows and the fatherless, and deprive aliens of justice, but do not fear me," says the LORD Almighty.

verses.esv: 34 You shall treat the stranger who sojourns with you as the native among you, and you shall love him as yourself, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
verses.kjv: 34 But the stranger that dwelleth with you shall be unto you as one born among you, and thou shalt love him as thyself; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
verses.niv: 34 The alien living with you must be treated as one of your native-born. Love him as yourself, for you were aliens in Egypt. I am the LORD your God.

verses.esv:
9   The LORD watches over the sojourners;
    he upholds the widow and the fatherless,
    but the way of the wicked he brings to ruin.
verses.kjv: 9 The LORD preserveth the strangers; he relieveth the fatherless and widow: but the way of the wicked he turneth upside down.
verses.niv: 9 The LORD watches over the alien and sustains the fatherless and the widow, but he frustrates the ways of the wicked.

verses.esv: 35 For I was hungry and you gave me food, I was thirsty and you gave me drink, I was a stranger and you welcomed me,
verses.kjv: 35 For I was an hungred, and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me in:
verses.niv: 35 For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink, I was a stranger and you invited me in,

verses.esv: 22 You shall have the same rule for the sojourner and for the native, for I am the LORD your God.”
verses.kjv: 22 Ye shall have one manner of law, as well for the stranger, as for one of your own country: for I am the LORD your God.
verses.niv: 22 You are to have the same law for the alien and the native-born. I am the LORD your God.'"

verses.esv: 22 “And when you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not reap your field right up to its edge, nor shall you gather the gleanings after your harvest. You shall leave them for the poor and for the sojourner: I am the LORD your God.”
verses.kjv: 22 And when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not make clean riddance of the corners of thy field when thou reapest, neither shalt thou gather any gleaning of thy harvest: thou shalt leave them unto the poor, and to the stranger: I am the LORD your God.
verses.niv: 22 "'When you reap the harvest of your land, do not reap to the very edges of your field or gather the gleanings of your harvest. Leave them for the poor and the alien. I am the LORD your God.'"

verses.esv: 19 “‘Cursed be anyone who perverts the justice due to the sojourner, the fatherless, and the widow.’ And all the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
verses.kjv: 19 Cursed be he that perverteth the judgment of the stranger, fatherless, and widow. And all the people shall say, Amen.
verses.niv: 19 "Cursed is the man who withholds justice from the alien, the fatherless or the widow." Then all the people shall say, "Amen!"

verses.esv: 10 And you shall not strip your vineyard bare, neither shall you gather the fallen grapes of your vineyard. You shall leave them for the poor and for the sojourner: I am the LORD your God.
verses.kjv: 10 And thou shalt not glean thy vineyard, neither shalt thou gather every grape of thy vineyard; thou shalt leave them for the poor and stranger: I am the LORD your God.
verses.niv: 10 Do not go over your vineyard a second time or pick up the grapes that have fallen. Leave them for the poor and the alien. I am the LORD your God.

verses.esv: 19 So then you are no longer strangers and aliens, but you are fellow citizens with the saints and members of the household of God,
verses.kjv: 19 Now therefore ye are no more strangers and foreigners, but fellowcitizens with the saints, and of the household of God;
verses.niv: 19 Consequently, you are no longer foreigners and aliens, but fellow citizens with God's people and members of God's household,

verses.esv: 18 He executes justice for the fatherless and the widow, and loves the sojourner, giving him food and clothing. 19 Love the sojourner, therefore, for you were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
verses.kjv: 18 He doth execute the judgment of the fatherless and widow, and loveth the stranger, in giving him food and raiment. 19 Love ye therefore the stranger: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
verses.niv: 18 He defends the cause of the fatherless and the widow, and loves the alien, giving him food and clothing. 19 And you are to love those who are aliens, for you yourselves were aliens in Egypt.

verses.esv: 3 Thus says the LORD: Do justice and righteousness, and deliver from the hand of the oppressor him who has been robbed. And do no wrong or violence to the resident alien, the fatherless, and the widow, nor shed innocent blood in this place.
verses.kjv: 3 Thus saith the LORD; Execute ye judgment and righteousness, and deliver the spoiled out of the hand of the oppressor: and do no wrong, do no violence to the stranger, the fatherless, nor the widow, neither shed innocent blood in this place.
verses.niv: 3 This is what the LORD says: Do what is just and right. Rescue from the hand of his oppressor the one who has been robbed. Do no wrong or violence to the alien, the fatherless or the widow, and do not shed innocent blood in this place.

verses.esv: 13 Contribute to the needs of the saints and seek to show hospitality.
verses.kjv: 13 Distributing to the necessity of saints; given to hospitality.
verses.niv: 13 Share with God's people who are in need. Practice hospitality.

verses.esv: 11 Beloved, I urge you as sojourners and exiles to abstain from the passions of the flesh, which wage war against your soul.
verses.kjv: 11 Dearly beloved, I beseech you as strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul;
verses.niv: 11 Dear friends, I urge you, as aliens and strangers in the world, to abstain from sinful desires, which war against your soul.

verses.esv: 14 “You shall not oppress a hired worker who is poor and needy, whether he is one of your brothers or one of the sojourners who are in your land within your towns.
verses.kjv: 14 Thou shalt not oppress an hired servant that is poor and needy, whether he be of thy brethren, or of thy strangers that are in thy land within thy gates:
verses.niv: 14 Do not take advantage of a hired man who is poor and needy, whether he is a brother Israelite or an alien living in one of your towns.

verses.esv: 49 There shall be one law for the native and for the stranger who sojourns among you.”
verses.kjv: 49 One law shall be to him that is homeborn, and unto the stranger that sojourneth among you.
verses.niv: 49 The same law applies to the native-born and to the alien living among you."

verses.esv: 21 “So you shall divide this land among you according to the tribes of Israel. 22 You shall allot it as an inheritance for yourselves and for the sojourners who reside among you and have had children among you. They shall be to you as native-born children of Israel. With you they shall be allotted an inheritance among the tribes of Israel. 23 In whatever tribe the sojourner resides, there you shall assign him his inheritance, declares the Lord GOD.
verses.kjv: 21 So shall ye divide this land unto you according to the tribes of Israel. 22 And it shall come to pass, that ye shall divide it by lot for an inheritance unto you, and to the strangers that sojourn among you, which shall beget children among you: and they shall be unto you as born in the country among the children of Israel; they shall have inheritance with you among the tribes of Israel. 23 And it shall come to pass, that in what tribe the stranger sojourneth, there shall ye give him his inheritance, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.niv: 21 "You are to distribute this land among yourselves according to the tribes of Israel. 22 You are to allot it as an inheritance for yourselves and for the aliens who have settled among you and who have children. You are to consider them as native-born Israelites; along with you they are to be allotted an inheritance among the tribes of Israel. 23 In whatever tribe the alien settles, there you are to give him his inheritance," declares the Sovereign LORD.

verses.esv: 11 Here there is not Greek and Jew, circumcised and uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian, slave, free; but Christ is all, and in all.
verses.kjv: 11 Where there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarian, Scythian, bond nor free: but Christ is all, and in all.
verses.niv: 11 Here there is no Greek or Jew, circumcised or uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian, slave or free, but Christ is all, and is in all.

verses.esv: 7 “You shall not abhor an Edomite, for he is your brother. You shall not abhor an Egyptian, because you were a sojourner in his land.
verses.kjv: 7 Thou shalt not abhor an Edomite; for he is thy brother: thou shalt not abhor an Egyptian; because thou wast a stranger in his land.
verses.niv: 7 Do not abhor an Edomite, for he is your brother. Do not abhor an Egyptian, because you lived as an alien in his country.

verses.esv: 20 But our citizenship is in heaven, and from it we await a Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.kjv: 20 For our conversation is in heaven; from whence also we look for the Saviour, the Lord Jesus Christ:
verses.niv: 20 But our citizenship is in heaven. And we eagerly await a Savior from there, the Lord Jesus Christ,

verses.esv: 14 For the whole law is fulfilled in one word: “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.kjv: 14 For all the law is fulfilled in one word, even in this; Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.
verses.niv: 14 The entire law is summed up in a single command: "Love your neighbor as yourself."
